title: [Hack Day] Building a $100MM solopreneur business with MSR and GitHub Copilot – GeekWire Events Calendar
description: ​GitHub & Microsoft Research Present: Builders Hack Day Seattle ​Are you using tools like AI Agents for marketing? outreach? coding? design? Are you building a technology company? Do you want… Read More
content:
​Are you using tools like AI Agents for marketing? outreach? coding? design? Are you building a technology company? Do you want to build your own tech startup?

​​We’ll be hosting a full day Builders Hack Day at GitHub in Seattle. Our goal is to empower builders with the community.

​​This event is designed to connect builders and founders like you with the Microsoft Research Team and the Investor network in Seattle.

​Plus, it’s a special research edition Hackathon: By participating in the hackathon, you’ll also be joining a Microsoft Research study that will help define how AI empowers the next generation of founders. Learn more about this research below.

​Ready to build something amazing while shaping the future of AI for startups?

​Register now to secure your place because there are limited spots available.

​🛠 What You Will Build

​You will build commercially viable, innovative products using Microsoft’s open-source projects: GraphRAG and NLWeb.

​They’re foundational technologies designed to supercharge your product development. With GraphRAG, you’ll harness graph-based retrieval-augmented generation for multi-hop reasoning, explainable outputs, and enterprise-grade knowledge synthesis. With NLWeb, you’ll explore natural language interfaces that unlock web-scale intelligence and semantic search capabilities.

​The top 6-10 projects will be invited to pitch to a panel of investors on Tuesday evening including Kevin Crosby, GitHub Fund, Jon Turow – Madrona, and others.

​🚀 Not JUST another hackathon – What You Get

​This isn’t just another hackathon – you’ll receive free access to GitHub’s latest Copilot development tools, plus priority technical support from GitHub Developer Advocate team during the hackathon. You’ll also have direct pitch and demo opportunities with PNW VCs and technical leaders from GitHub and Microsoft.

​As part of Microsoft Research’s study on AI-accelerated startup development, teams are randomly assigned to one of two advanced Copilot feature configurations to help us understand how different AI approaches impact development speed, creativity, and outcomes.
summary: The GeekWire Events Calendar will host a full day Builders Hack Day at GitHub in Seattle, aimed at empowering builders and founders with the Microsoft Research Team and the Investor network. The event will also be a special research edition Hackathon, where participants will participate in a Microsoft Research study on AI-accelerated startup development to help define how AI empowers the next generation of founders. Participants will be able to build commercially viable products using Microsoft's open-source projects: GraphRAG and NLWeb. The top 6-10 projects will be invited to pitch to a panel of investors. Additionally, participants will receive free access to GitHub’s Copilot development tools and technical support from the GitHub Developer Advocate team.
shortSummary: A full day of hackathon at GitHub, allowing builders to develop innovative products and participate in a Microsoft Research study on AI-accelerated startup development.
argos_summary: GitHub is hosting a full-day Builders Hack Day in Seattle to empower founders and builders, connecting them with Microsoft Research and a local investor network. Participants will develop commercially viable products using Microsoft’s open-source tools GraphRAG and NLWeb, with the top projects pitching to investors such as Kevin Crosby and representatives from GitHub Fund and Madrona. The event also offers free access to GitHub Copilot development tools, priority support, and a chance to contribute to a Microsoft Research study on how AI accelerates startup development.
